@iche033 Your last comment confuses me but then I am a total noob with Docker and the AWS. Let me see if I understand:

1. The AWS will start
1. The Dockerfile will be invoked - that is allowed access to the Internet to load packages and GitHub files
1. A startup script is run.
1. After that there is no access to the Internet for package or other uploads. 

I still think there is much more that SRC could include in the base image in addition to the "FROM ros:indigo-ros-base" that would speed the Docker setup. Everything in the scpeters dockerfile is going to be needed and probably much more. Even if teams didn't need some of it there is no cost to having it loaded.
